intro: Dracaena arborescens, commonly known as the orange tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and dense, glossy green foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that eventually develop into orange-colored fruits. Dracaena arborescens thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and air-purifying properties.
